name: places/ChIJ6xLCOFNYwokRHr0BkWIbIvU
adrFormatAddress: 625 8th Ave, New York, NY 10018, USA

originalText.text: Excellent experience traveling from NYC to Baltimore. Ticket was easy to purchase and cost $51 after tax. Nonstop service apart from a brief bathroom break. The Peter Pan buses are cleaner than Greyhound.

text.text: Excellent experience traveling from NYC to Baltimore. Ticket was easy to purchase and cost $51 after tax. Nonstop service apart from a brief bathroom break. The Peter Pan buses are cleaner than Greyhound.

originalText.text: I’ve taken this bus from NYC to Washington DC ~8 times. It’s around $30, they leave on time, and they enforce the rule of people using headphones with their device, which I super appreciate. There’s often enough space that the seat next to me is free. We arrive in on time. There is a bathroom that is stocked with toilet paper and sanitizer. My reason for 4 stars instead of five is, I was sick this week and canceled my travel plan. There’s not a system where you can get a credit, you have to commit to a future day. For me, it would’ve been a $10 switch fee, and since I am not sure when I’m going again I just ate the cost of the ticket. I couldn’t figure it out on the site (this was before I gave up on figuring out when I would be going next ) and relied on people picking up a phone that I’m guessing is manned by very few people. The person I finally got through to was very nice, but I’m talking 15+ attempts.  They did get back to me from the form I sent on the site, faster than the site said they would. So if anyone from the company reads this, my main critique is to make it easier to switch online, and have a system for credit, even if it expires in 6 months. Life is uncertain. I don’t want to pay an extra two dollars or whatever it is every time I’m planning my travel in case I’m sick. I feel like this should be covered.

originalText.text: I have been using Peterpan for years and I can honestly say I have never had one issue! I absolutely love Peterpan! I love the costumer service, the drivers, the representatives at the station. They're always in a great mood, willing to help, friendly, out going, and drive safe! If I could give more than 5 stars I would! I would recommend Peterpan bus line to friends, family, and anyone who wants to travel! They also do price matching!⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

originalText.text: Good wifi.  If you are punctual I don't recommend this bus. Monday 01-18-24. NY-Baltimore. Departure at 6pm but the driver was there at 6:08pm. Arriving: 9:20pm but the driver arrived at 9:50pm. He was very slow and grouchy. Same case at come back, scheduled arrival to NY at 11:20am and it arrived at 12m. They are too strict with silence, exaggerated (it doesn't happen on other buses like the megabus, for example)

originalText.text:
Please never travel with Peter pan from NY.  I had just once with them driver was extremely rude disrespectful. It was first day of new year, very bad experience in my life.
Highly recommend Megabus and Flixbus.
